data.title: Tab Size ignored on code auto format  (intermittent)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.2 (7ba55c5860b152d999dda59393ca3ebeb1b5c85f, 2016-11-21T22:14:18.217Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 3.13.0-101-generic
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|puppet|Borke|0.3.0|
|jslint|ajhyndman|1.2.1|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.1.0|
|Angular1|johnpapa|0.1.16|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.2.2|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|4.0.2|
|code-spell-checker|streetsidesoftware|0.12.0|

---

Steps to Reproduce (intermittent):

I have not figured out what steps exactly causing issue to happen, but I encounter it 5-6 times a day.

1. set user preferences: "editor.tabSize": 2,
2. unknown action
3. auto format file
4. file will be formatted with 4 spaces instead of 2

Observations: 
- issue happens on single file, other opened files are not affected
- pressing TAB creates correct (2 spaces) indentation
- closing file doesnt fix it, only closing whole studio

data.title: Javascript syntax highlighting inconsistency
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Win10

Steps to Reproduce:
canvas's 2d context has a func called "moveTo"
example:
```javascript
c.moveTo(0, 0); //moveTo is highlighted the same way as a keyword
c.lineTo(100, 100); //lineTo is highlighted the same way as a function
```
Looks like it revolves around the "move":
```javascript
obj.move(); //move is highlighted as a keyword (bad)
obj.moved(); //moved is highlighted as a function (good)
obj.moveT(); //moveT is highlighted as a function (good)
obj.moveTo(); //moveTo is highlighted as a keyword again (bad)
```

Edit: looks like github syntax highlighter has the same issue, lol

data.title: Show an icon inside explorer to open files to the side
data.body:
Right now it is possible to open a file in a split-pane view when using the `cmd+P` palette.

It would be nice if we could have the split-pane icon appear when overing a file on the Explorer and be able to click it so that it opens in a new split-pane view. That function is already available by right-clicking and selecting "open to the side" but an icon would be much more user-friendly.

data.title: Go to definition crashes with "Cannot read property 'startLineNumber' of undefined" message
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Ask a language server for definition location
2. LS emits following JSON:
    ```json
    {
        "result": {
            "location": {
                "uri": "untitled:Untitled-1",
                "range": {
                    "start": {
                        "line": 0,
                        "character": 0
                    },
                    "end": {
                        "line": 0,
                        "character": 1
                    }
                }
            }
        },
        "jsonrpc": "2.0",
        "id": 29
    }
    ```
3. VS Code shows warning about startLineNumber property

There's a stack trace in console:

```
Cannot read property 'startLineNumber' of undefined: TypeError: Cannot read property 'startLineNumber' of undefined
    at Function.e.collapseToStart (file:////usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:39:8028)
    at file:////usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:77:26260
    at Object.g [as _notify] (file:////usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:31:10217)
    at Object.enter (file:////usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:31:13795)
    at _run (file:////usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:31:15623)
    at _completed (file:////usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:31:15064)
    at u (file:////usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:31:18602)
    at Y.then.r.(anonymous function) (file:////usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:31:18819)
    at Object.g [as _notify] (file:////usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:31:10217)
    at Object.enter (file:////usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:31:13795)
```

----

For some reason callback receives mangled URI with lots of undefineds (taken from debugger as early as 3rd frame at the bottom of the stack):
```json
{
    "seq": "99",
    "res": {
        "uri": {
            "scheme": "",
            "authority": "",
            "path": "undefined",
            "fsPath": "undefined",
            "query": "",
            "fragment": "",
            "external": "undefined",
            "$mid": 1
        }
    }
}
```

Maybe similar to #12353

data.title: Empty signature box and TypeError exception in console
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Ask a language server for signature help
2. LS emits following JSON:
    ```json
    {
    "result": {
        "signatures": [
        {
            "documentation": "param? I hardly knew it.",
            "parameters": [
            {
                "documentation": "something",
                "label": "this"
            },
            {
                "label": "that"
            }
            ],
            "label": "param"
        }
        ]
    },
    "jsonrpc": "2.0",
    "id": 13
    }
    ```
3. Editor shows a tiny empty box hovering, without any signatures

There's an exception logged in console:
```
workbench.main.js:126 Cannot read property 'parameters' of undefined: TypeError: Cannot read property 'parameters' of undefined
    at e.render (file:////usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:72:8261)
    at file:////usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:72:6011
    at e.invoke (file:////usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:29:22801)
    at e.fire (file:////usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:30:1364)
    at file:////usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:72:4479
    at Object.g [as _notify] (file:////usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:31:10217)
    at Object.enter (file:////usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:31:13795)
    at _run (file:////usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:31:15623)
    at _completed (file:////usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:31:15064)
    at then (file:////usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:31:17056)
```

Offending code in workbench.main.js (unminified):

```javascript
                    this.docs.innerHTML = "";
                    var t = this.hints.signatures[this.currentSignature]
                      , i = r.append(this.signature, b(".code"))
                      , o = t.parameters.length > 0
                      , a = this.editor.getConfiguration().fontInfo;
```

`this.currentSignature` is undefined as per [SignatureHelp result](https://github.com/Microsoft/language-server-protocol/blob/master/protocol.md#signature-help-request) (`activeSignature` is optional there).

data.title: signatureHelp.activeSignature
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Win10 Enterprise x64

Hello.

In VSCode 1.6 the behavior of activeSignature parameter was changed.
Before 1.6 if you *don't* assign any value to it, the window with signatures was shown without any glitches.
In 1.7 if you *don't* assing a value to it, you'll get:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1132840/20745659/5bc1f1ea-b6f3-11e6-8df9-9539fa045e1e.png)

Looks like the activeSignature parameter is mandatory now in "direct implementation" model, but **not** mandatory in language-server model - https://github.com/Microsoft/language-server-protocol/blob/master/protocol.md#signature-help-request

**But**  
In direct implemantation you can't get the current active signature, selected by user. And now (in >=1.6) you need to reassign it to `0` every time the signature provider is triggered, and you just override user active signature every that time.

Please, make activeSignature not mandatory againg in direct implementation, or provide a method, to get user selected signature.

/cc @bambr1975

data.title: Can't see Git Gutter in Windows.
data.body:

1. Open any file
2. Make changes

```
{
  "git.autofetch": false,
  "javascript.validate.enable": false,
  "editor.renderWhitespace": "all",
  "files.trimTrailingWhitespace": false,
  "eslint.nodePath": "ui/node_modules",
  "css.validate": false,
  "stylelint.enable": true
}
```

I think it broke somewhere around 1.7-insider, and I can't get it to work at all.

data.title: Provider a better completion navigation/details interaction

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Completion items (e.g. as produced by a language server) can provide 'big' documentation strings. It would be nice to display these big strings in a popup side-panel in a manner similar to how Eclipse does this.

It's actually one of the few ways in which Eclipse ui is 'better' than many other an IDE. Seeing the full doc for the method or type you are completing on easily accessible right next to the completions menu is, in my opinion, really convenient.

vscode right now shows a kind of 'shortened' version of the documentation (which can look really uggly, depending on whether the original source looks good when you just strip out newlines to attempt to display it on a single line). vscode also provides a little 'info' button you can click which opens the 'detailed' view of the docs. This is not very convenient because the extra clicks and context switch between completions view and 'details view' makes it rather hard to navigate quickly between completions and see their respective docs before making a choice on which completion you really wanted to pick.

Note: somewhat related. It would be nice if the 'side view' was capable of rendering markdown properly. But perhaps that is really a separate issue. And maybe it is covered already by this issue ticket:

https://github.com/Microsoft/language-server-protocol/issues/137

data.title: Don't reversibly discard changes when renaming a file or folder
data.body:
The editor currently warns the user that their unsaved changes to an open file will be discarded if they rename the file or a folder containing the file. The dialog displaying this warning has the default action result in irreversible data loss.

I propose changing this behavior, either by changing the default action to cancel the renaming operation, or some how preventing the discarding of unsaved changes during this operation.

data.title: Allow text after the language id in a markdown codeblock
data.body:
This patch alters the regex to match on gfm codeblock start expressions so that vscode allows text after the language id in a markdown codeblock. 

This brings it in line with the way that github itself handles gfm codeblocks as well as the markdown preview rendering window (and some other gfm parsers)

What should be supported:
~~~ markdown
``` LANGUAGE_ID <some-text-can-be-here>
<language-specific-code>
```
~~~

This simply allows text after the whitespace in a gfm codeblock so that vscode continues to recognize the content as a valid gfm codeblock.

IE:

~~~ markdown
###  some markdown text
``` yaml somefile.yaml
foo: bar
bin: 
   baz: true
``` 
~~~

Should still color-syntax-highlight the content in the codeblock like:

###  some markdown text
``` yaml somefile.yaml
foo: bar
bin: 
   baz: true
```
